Download and Setup¶

Recommended setup for Windows¶

  1. Download TagUI v6.0.0 for Windows.

  2. Unzip the contents to C:\.

  3. Install OpenJDK for Windows).

  4. Install Chrome (if not yet installed).

  5. Run setx path "%path%;c:\tagui\src" in Command Prompt.

Troubleshooting

  • If you see ‘MSVCR110.dll is missing’ error, install Visual C++ Redistributable (choose vcredist_x86.exe).

  • If you cannot unzip to C:\, unzip to your desktop.

Recommended setup for macOS/Linux¶

  1. Download TagUI v6.0.0 (macOS, Linux).

  2. Unzip the contents to your desktop on macOS, or /home/your_userid on Linux.

  3. Install OpenJDK (macOS, Linux).

  4. Install Chrome (if not yet installed).

  5. Run ln -sf /your_tagui_path/tagui/src/tagui /usr/local/bin/tagui in Terminal.

Troubleshooting

  • For newer macOS versions, if you get a dyld: Library not loaded error, install OpenSSL in this way. macOS Catalina update has introduced tighter security controls, see solutions for the PhantomJS and Java popups.

  • Linux distributions which do not have PHP pre-installed (eg. Ubuntu) must install PHP separately.

Running your first flow¶

On Windows, run this in Command Prompt:

tagui c:\tagui\src\samples\1_yahoo chrome

On macOS/Linux, run this in Terminal:

./tagui your_tagui_path\tagui\src\samples\1_yahoo chrome

Congratulations, you have run your first TagUI flow!

Cutting edge version¶

To use the latest features and fixes, first download TagUI with the recommended setup above, then download the cutting edge version and overwrite the files in the tagui/src/ folder.
